body_content.explanation: an occasion when a volcano explodes, and flames and rocks come out of it, or the act of doing this:
examples: Around the year 600, the eruption of a nearby volcano buried Ceren's buildings.

body_content.explanation: the act of starting suddenly and violently:
examples: There was a violent eruption of anti-government feeling.
The curfew was aimed at preventing any eruption of violence in the capital.

body_content.explanation: the act of suddenly expressing your feelings in a noisy way:
examples: He became increasingly prone to eruptions of bad temper.
His comment triggered an eruption of laughter.

body_content.explanation: an occasion when spots suddenly appear on your face:
examples: Skin eruptions are common to many of us during times of stress.

body_content.explanation: an occasion when a tooth appears through the gum (= the flesh surrounding the teeth) for the first time:
examples: She was taking painkillers to help with the painful eruption of a wisdom tooth.
